title: ADMINISTRATIVE EXEMPTION and TRADE, TRAVEL AND TOURISM COMMITTEE REPORT relative to the First Amendment to Contract No. DA-5640 with Vista Paint Corporation for supply and delivery of retro-reflective glass beads for the Los Angeles World Airports (LAWA).

appearances.recommendation: CONCUR with the determination by the Board of Airport Commissioners (BOAC) that this action is administratively exempt from the California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) pursuant to Article II, Section 2(f) of the Los Angeles City CEQA Guidelines. APPROVE BOAC Resolution No. 28222 authorizing a First Amendment to Contract No. DA-5640 with Vista Paint Corporation for the supply and delivery of retro-reflective glass beats by increasing the total contract compensation by $1,860,000, from $2,790,000 to $4,650,000; and, extending the current term by two years from May 30, 2026 to May 29, 2028 for a total term of 115 months. AUTHORIZE the Chief Executive Officer, LAWA, or designee, to execute the proposed First Amendment upon approval by the Council and approval as to form by the City Attorney. Fiscal Impact Statement: The City Administrative Officer (CAO) reports that approval of the proposed First Amendment to Contract No. DA-5640 with Vista Paint Corporation for the supply and delivery of retro-reflective glass beads will have no impact on the General Fund. The two-year extension will increase the total contract authority by $1,860,000 from $2,790,000 to $4,650,000. Funding is programmed under LAWA’s Cost Center 1150042 - Airside Maintenance & Repair, Commitment Item 522 - Materials and Supplies. Funding for subsequent years is subject to approval of the annual budget. The recommendations in the CAO report comply with the LAWA’s adopted Financial Policies. Community Impact Statement: None submitted. TIME LIMIT FILE - NOVEMBER 30, 2025 (LAST DAY FOR COUNCIL ACTION - NOVEMBER 14, 2025) Report from Trade, Travel and Tourism Committee 10-14-25 Report from Board of Airport Commissioners dated 8-25-25 Attachment to Report dated 8-25-25 - Board Report Attachment to Report dated 8-25-25 - Resolution Attachment to Report dated 8-25-25 - Agreement Attachment to Report dated 8-25-25 - Mayor Transmittal Attachment to Report dated 8-25-25 - CAO Report

attachments.title: Report from Trade, Travel and Tourism Committee 10-14-25
attachments.summary:
# Summary: Contract Amendment for Airport Maintenance Supplies

## What Is Being Proposed?
The Trade, Travel and Tourism Committee is recommending that the Los Angeles City Council approve a contract amendment with Vista Paint Corporation to continue supplying retroreflective glass beads (reflective materials used on airport runways and taxiways) for Los Angeles World Airports (LAWA). The amendment would increase the contract value by $1.86 million and extend the agreement for two additional years.

## Key Details
- **Contract:** First Amendment to Contract DA-5640 with Vista Paint Corporation
- **Financial Impact:** Total contract value increases from $2.79 million to $4.65 million
- **Duration:** Contract extends two years, from May 30, 2026 to May 29, 2028 (115 months total)
- **Funding Source:** LAWA's Cost Center for Airside Maintenance & Repair; no impact on the city's General Fund
- **Committee Vote:** Unanimous approval (Park, McOsker, and Rodriguez all voted YES on October 14, 2025)

## Why This Matters
Retroreflective glass beads are essential safety materials that help pilots see runway markings during low-visibility conditions. This amendment ensures LAWA can maintain continuous supply of this critical safety material without service interruption. The City Attorney has approved the contract language, and the Board of Airport Commissioners determined this action does not require environmental review under CEQA.

attachments.title: Report from Board of Airport Commissioners dated 8-25-25
attachments.summary:
# Summary: First Amendment to Vista Paint Corporation Contract (DA-5640)

## What is Being Proposed?
The Board of Airport Commissioners is requesting City Council approval to extend and expand an existing contract with Vista Paint Corporation for the supply and delivery of retro-reflective glass beads used at Los Angeles World Airports. The amendment would extend the contract term through May 29, 2028, and increase the contract value by $1,860,000.

## Key Details
The contract amendment will raise the total contract authority from $2,790,000 to $4,650,000. The original contract (DA-5640) involves supplying retro-reflective glass beads—materials used for safety marking and visibility purposes at airport facilities. The Board of Airport Commissioners approved this action on August 21, 2025, through Resolution 28222. There is no impact to the city's General Fund, meaning the cost will be covered through airport operations funding.

## City Council Recommendations
The Council is being asked to: (1) approve the contract amendment; (2) concur that the amendment is exempt from California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) requirements; and (3) authorize the Los Angeles World Airports CEO or designee to execute the amendment on the city's behalf.

## Impact
This contract supports ongoing airport operations and safety infrastructure maintenance. The three-year extension ensures continuity of supply for critical airport safety materials without disrupting services to Los Angeles World Airports.
